user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Red', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Normal']
review_content:
I feel like more people should be talking about these! The formula is so unique. I love cream products and this is kind of a putty texture that goes on like a cream, but dries down so there is no sticky feeling (which I hate). I completely agree with the blurring claim. It’s such a soft focus kind of finish. I use a dense brush to stipple it on first, then use circular motions to blend it out. Also, this Blurred Buff color is a dupe (in color) for Glossier’s cloud paint in Dusk. But, this is great because sometimes I don’t want to mess with a liquid product. On my cool, fair complexion, this rosy bronze shade works perfectly as a bronzer/blush hybrid for no makeup, makeup days. I feel like I need to order a backup in case it gets discontinued. So good!
…read more

user_specs: ['Eye Color Green', 'Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
Overall this bare minerals bounce and blur is a nice blush. The texture is smooth and extremely easy to apply. The color is very vibrant and not very forgiving if you apply too heavy the first time. Compared to the bounce and blur eyeshadow the blush doesn’t “blur” as much. If you are very careful when applying you will be fine but if you over do it the pigment is hard to blend or lighten. The color lasts all day and you can create softer touches of color or bolder defined cheekbones with the same blush. I like the product and will continue to use it but I wish the color was a little more forgiving for such a vibrant tone. This review was written in return for complimentary testing of the product.

If you have a deeper than medium-tan complexion, you should layer a powder blush on top for color payoff and longevity. I received this product complimentary for testing purposes from Influenster.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Light', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
Since the Bounce & Blur eyeshadow didn’t really “wow” me, I was prepared to be underwhelmed by this product as well but this blush really surprised me! At first, I was worried that the color (Mauve Sunrise) was going to be a bit boring but it was so soft and buildable that I could easily take it from a natural flush to something more dramatic. The formula was buttery (just like the Bounce & Blur eyeshadow) and applied well with a brush. The blush didn’t smudge my foundation or smear when I applied other products. Bonus: the color stayed true all day, even on days when I didn’t use setting spray! Needless to say, I am very happy to have this blush in my collection and have been reaching for it more than my blushes from MAC and NARS. Aaaand for the not-so-fine print: I received a deluxe sample of this product for free for testing purposes.

review_content: LOVEEEE! I got the Mauve sunrise color for free for testing purposes and I have to say I use it everyday such a nice shade. It’s pigmented and has a nice shimmer which makes your skin look youthful and radiant. This blush has a wet texture to it, and it applies evenly doesn’t blanch or look patchy. This blush is also not powdery so this is great for dry skin highly recommend!

review_title: A soft glow with high color payoff!
review_content:
The bounce and blur blush has a nice creamy texture that blends well with the fingertips, perfect for someone who needs to apply and dash. The pigmentation is really nice! Little goes a very long way and even lays well over a powdered base. I recieved this blush in this mauve tone for the purposes of reviewing. I enjoyed the formula, but the cooler tone of this doesn't work well with my warm skin tone. I would purchase this in a color more suited for my particular skin tone. I recieved this product for the purpose of reviewing.

review_content: Like many others, was worried ‘‘tis was going to be too dark but, it goes on very sheer. Gives a ice healthy flush to the skin. Like the bounce and blur eyeshadows, this product is great for no makeup/subtle looks. Don’t expect a great color payoff here.

Are used my fingers at first to apply and then went over it with a beauty blender. I received this product complementary in exchange for my honest review.

user_specs: ['Hair color Blonde', 'Skin Tone Fair', 'Skin Type Oily']
review_content:
The Bounce and Blur Blush is a new favorite of mine. Creamy texture and nicely pigmented. The color blends well with my contour. The application is best when you use your fingers but I prefer brush application. I haven't found a brush that picks up the creamy texture yet. When I use my finger to apply, I feel that it doesn't move once its laid down onto skin which can be a pro and con. Con because it can leave spots that are darker than intended, don't be to heavy handed. Pro because this blush stays all night long. Over all, I love the texture, color and long lasting wear. Might try the other shades for fun! This product was received complimentary of Influenster for testing and review purpose! Example picture attached. I received this product complimentary for review purposes. Pro tip: Blush is important to add some color to your face, blend your blush to the top of your jaw contour, let those colors touch but CAUTION with this specific blush, it won't budge if you put too much on.

user_specs: ['Eye Color Brown', 'Hair color Brunette', 'Skin Tone Olive', 'Skin Type Combination']
review_content:
I loved this color blush! It went really well with my olive skin tone and it went on really smoothly. I used a brush to apply and I liked that the color stayed only on the area I applied it to. It was very true to color and lasted all day. My mom also borrowed it for a wedding and said she got lots of compliments. We have different skin tones and the color looked great on both of us. It felt light on our skin and I felt like my pores could still breathe with it on. Definitely recommend this color from Bare Minerals. Thanks Influenster and Bare Minerals for letting me try this blush for free!
